bibl.title: Memorandum from [Henry Rose Carter] to Assistant Surgeon-General Trask, June 2, 1916

div1.p: [Carter] outlines the roles of Griffitts, LePrince, and von Ezdorf in work involving impounded waters.

div1.head: Memorandum from [Henry Rose Carter] to Assistant Surgeon-General Trask, June 2, 1916
div1.p:
1. Griffith to be in charge of investigation of effect
of Impounded Waters on incidence of Malaria, until LePrince
can (more or less) permanently assume charge.

2. LePrince to have this work at such time as he is needed
for engineering projects with Von Esdorf and as he can leave
it without loss to the work. Von Esdorf, (in consultation with
LePrince) to be judge of such detail. When LePrince is absent
Griffith to be in charge.

3. Write to Griffith (and later to LePrince) giving them
the same authority to employ men, and visit places that I
I had, (Bureau letter April 28, 1916), except include North
Carolina among the states, in which work is to be done and
omit Georgia. No work is contemplated in Georgia while the
Whitney Pond in North Carolina, will require a rather exten-
sive survey.

4. There will be very little launch hire this year, (launch
was generally furnished free last year) but there will be
some hire of vehicles, horse vehicles, not automobile, same
in very exceptional cases.
